porāṇam'etaṃ atula, n'etaṃ ajjatanām'iva, nindanti tuṇhim'āsīnaṃ, nindanti bahubhāṇinaṃ, mitabhāṇim'pi nindanti, n'atthi loke anindito.
bhikkhuṃ pan'eva uddissa aññātako gahapati vā gahapatānī vā tantavāyehi cīvaraṃ vāyāpeyya, tatra ce so bhikkhu pubbe appavārito tantavāye upasaṅkamitvā cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjeyya
example_2: yo pana bhikkhu aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā purāṇacīvaraṃ dhovāpeyya vā rajāpeyya vā ākoṭāpeyya vā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

example_1: tuvañ'ca bhante anukampakaṃ viduṃ, upecca vandiṃ kusalañ'ca pucchisaṃ, tato te ucchussa adāsi khaṇḍikaṃ, pasannacitā atulāya pītiyā'ti.
example_2: porāṇam'etaṃ atula, n'etaṃ ajjatanām'iva, nindanti tuṇhim'āsīnaṃ, nindanti bahubhāṇinaṃ, mitabhāṇim'pi nindanti, n'atthi loke anindito.

example_1: yo c'āyaṃ attakilamatha-anuyogo dukkho anariyo anatthasañhito.

example_1: yo c'āyaṃ attakilamath'ānuyogo dukkho anariyo anatthasañhito.
example_2: na kāmasukham'anuyuñjeyya hīnaṃ gammaṃ pothujjanikaṃ anariyaṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ, na ca attakilamath'ānuyogam'anuyuñjeyya dukkhaṃ anariyaṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ.

meaning: is settled (on); has made up one's mind (about); has faith (in); inclines (towards)
example_1: yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṃ saddahati adhimuccati, ayaṃ vuccati saddh'ānusārī, okkanto sammattaniyāmaṃ, sappurisabhūmiṃ okkanto, vītivatto puthujjanabhūmiṃ.
example_2: so phasso anicco'ti passati, vedanā aniccā'ti passati, saññā aniccā'ti passati, saṅkhārā aniccā'ti passati, viññāṇaṃ aniccan'ti passati. tassa dhāt'ārammaṇam'eva cittaṃ pakkhandati pasīdati santiṭṭhati adhimuccati.

example_1: yo c'āyaṃ kāmesu kāmasukh'allik'ānuyogo hīno gammo pothujjaniko anariyo anatthasañhito
example_2: evarūpo, bhikkhave, puggalo ajjhupekkhitabbo na sevitabbo na bhajitabbo na payirupāsitabbo. taṃ kissa hetu? akkoseyya'pi maṃ paribhāseyya'pi maṃ anattham'pi maṃ kareyyā'ti.
example_3: yāva'd'eva anatthāya, ñattaṃ bālassa jāyati, hanti bālassa sukk'aṃsaṃ, muddham'assa vipātayaṃ.
example_4: idha yassa te honti aniṭṭhā akantā amanāpā rūpā saddā gandhā rasā phoṭṭhabbā dhammā, ye vā pan'assa te honti anatthakāmā ahitakāmā aphāsukakāmā ayogakkhemakāmā

example_1: yo c'āyaṃ attakilamath'ānuyogo dukkho anariyo anatthasañhito.
anādariye pācittiyaṃ.
example_2: parimaṇḍalaṃ nivāsetabbaṃ nābhimaṇḍalaṃ jāṇumaṇḍalaṃ paṭicchādentena. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca purato vā pacchato vā olambento nivāseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
example_3: hirīmā'yaṃ, bhikkhave, ottāpī appamatto hoti. so appamatto samāno bhabbo anādariyaṃ pahātuṃ dovacassataṃ pahātuṃ pāpamittataṃ pahātuṃ.

example_1: porāṇam'etaṃ atula, n'etaṃ ajjatanām'iva, nindanti tuṇhim'āsīnaṃ, nindanti bahubhāṇinaṃ, mitabhāṇim'pi nindanti, n'atthi loke anindito.

meaning: following; motivated by; acting according to
example_1: paññāya chetvā vipatha-anusārinaṃ, yogena niggayha pathe nivesiya, disvā samudayaṃ vibhavañ'ca sambhavaṃ, dāy'ādako hehisi aggavādino.
example_2: yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṃ saddahati adhimuccati, ayaṃ vuccati saddhā-anusārī, okkanto sammattaniyāmaṃ, sappurisabhūmiṃ okkanto, vītivatto puthujjanabhūmiṃ.
example_3: ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, puggalo dhamma-anusārī.

meaning: not covetous; not envious; not jealous
example_1: patilīno akuhako, apihālu amaccharī, appagabbho ajeguccho, pesuṇeyye ca no yuto.
seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, yāni kānici kulāni bahu'tthikāni appapurisāni tāni suppadhaṃsiyāni honti corehi kumbhatthenakehi.
kiñ'cā'pi so kamma karoti pāpakaṃ, kāyena vācā uda cetasā vā, abhabba so tassa paṭicchadāya, abhabbatā diṭṭhapadassa vuttā, idam'pi saṅghe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ, etena saccena suvatthi hotu.
example_2: na hi m'ettha, bhikkhave, abhabbatā vuttā.

meaning: more brilliant (than); more excellent (than); more wonderful (than)
example_1: idam'pi kho, mahārāja, sandiṭṭhikaṃ sāmaññaphalaṃ purimehi sandiṭṭhikehi sāmaññaphalehi abhikkantatarañ'ca paṇītatarañ'ca.
example_2: imesaṃ kho, potaliya, catunnaṃ puggalānaṃ katamo te puggalo khamati abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro cā'ti?

meaning: free from avarice; not selfish; not stingy; not covetous
example_1: patilīno akuhako, apihālu amaccharī, appagabbho ajeguccho, pesuṇeyye ca no yuto.

example_1: abhivādanasīlissa, niccaṃ vuḍḍh'āpacāyino, cattāro dhammā vaḍḍhanti, āyu vaṇṇo sukhaṃ balaṃ.
example_2: āyudo balado dhīro, vaṇṇado paṭibhāṇado. sukhassa dātā medhāvī, sukhaṃ so adhigacchati. āyuṃ datvā balaṃ vaṇṇaṃ, sukhañ'ca paṭibhānakaṃ, dīgh'āyu yasavā hoti, yattha yatth'ūpapajjati.
example_3: āyuṃ arogiyaṃ vaṇṇaṃ, saggaṃ uccākulīnataṃ, ratiyo patthayantena, uḷārā apar'āparā.

example_1: eta'r'ahi kho pan'āhaṃ, ānanda, jiṇṇo vuddho mahallako addhagato vayoanuppatto. āsītiko me vayo vattati.
example_2: ambho purisa, na tvaṃ addassa manussesu itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā āsītikaṃ vā nāvutikaṃ vā vassasatikaṃ vā jātiyā, jiṇṇaṃ gopānasivaṅkaṃ bhoggaṃ daṇḍaparāyanaṃ pavedhamānaṃ

example_1: jhāyiṃ virajam'āsīnaṃ, katakiccaṃ anāsavaṃ, pāraguṃ sabbadhammānaṃ, atthi pañhena āgamaṃ, aññāvimokkhaṃ pabrūhi, avijjāya pabhedanaṃ.
example_2: porāṇam'etaṃ atula, n'etaṃ ajjatanām'iva, nindanti tuṇhim'āsīnaṃ, nindanti bahubhāṇinaṃ, mitabhāṇim'pi nindanti, n'atthi loke anindito.

example_1: yāni kho pan'assa honti sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni jimheyyāni vaṅkeyyāni, tāni yathābhūtaṃ āvikattā hoti satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu.
example_2: yāni kho pan'assa honti sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni jimheyyāni vaṅkeyyāni, tāni yathābhūtaṃ sārathissa āvikattā hoti. tesam'assa sārathi abhinimmadanāya vāyamati.

meaning: just this; this very; this exact
example_1: kiñ'cā'pi so kamma karoti pāpakaṃ, kāyena vācā uda cetasā vā, abhabba so tassa paṭicchadāya, abhabbatā diṭṭhapadassa vuttā, idam'pi saṅghe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ, etena saccena suvatthi hotu.
kiñ'cā'pi so kammaṃ karoti pāpakaṃ, kāyena vācā'uda cetasā vā. abhabbo so tassa paṭicchādāya, abhabbatā diṭṭhapadassa vuttā.
example_2: atthaṅ'gato so uda vā so n'atthi, udāhu ve sassatiyā arogo, taṃ me munī sādhu viyākarohi, tathā hi te vidito esa dhammo.
example_3: ṭhitena kāyena ṭhitena cetasā, tiṭṭhaṃ nisinno uda vā sayāno, etaṃ satiṃ bhikkhu adhiṭṭhahāno, labhetha pubb'āpariyaṃ visesaṃ
example_4: samo visesī uda vā nihīno, yo maññatī so vivadetha tena, tīsu vidhāsu avikampamāno, samo visesī'ti na tassa hoti.

meaning: resentful; who bears a grudge; who harbours enmity; who is vengeful; having rancour
example_1: kodhano upanāhī ca, pāpamakkhī ca yo naro, vipannadiṭṭhi māyāvī, taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.
example_2: upanāhissa upanāho appahīno hoti, makkhissa makkho appahīno hoti, paḷāsissa paḷāso appahīno hoti, issukissa issā appahīnā hoti, maccharissa macchariyaṃ appahīnaṃ hoti
example_3: upanāhissa purisapuggalassa anupanāho hoti parinibbānāya. makkhissa purisapuggalassa amakkho hoti parinibbānāya.

example_1: te puttamaṃsāni c'eva khādeyyuṃ, ure ca paṭipiseyyuṃ, kahaṃ, ekaputtaka, kahaṃ, ekaputtakā'ti
example_2: abhumme kathaṃ nu bhaṇasi, sallaṃ me deva urasi kappesi, sattasatā te bhariyā, kathaṃ nu te tā bhavissanti.
example_3: tassa sā sukhā vedanā nirujjhati. sukhāya vedanāya nirodhā uppajjati dukkhā vedanā. so dukkhāya vedanāya phuṭṭho samāno socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati sammohaṃ āpajjati.

meaning: only young son; single young boy
example_1: dve jāyam'patikā taṃ ekaputtakaṃ piyaṃ manāpaṃ vadhitvā vallūrañ'ca soṇḍikañ'ca karitvā puttamaṃsāni khādantā
yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṃ saddahati adhimuccati, ayaṃ vuccati saddh'ānusārī, okkanto sammattaniyāmaṃ, sappurisabhūmiṃ okkanto, vītivatto puthujjanabhūmiṃ.

meaning: regret; shame in wrongdoing; respect for others
example_1: saddhādhanaṃ sīladhanaṃ, hirī ottappiyaṃ dhanaṃ, sutadhanañ'ca cāgo ca, paññā ve sattamaṃ dhanaṃ.
example_2: saddhābalaṃ vīriyañ'ca, hirī ottappiyaṃ balaṃ, satibalaṃ samādhi ca, paññā ve sattamaṃ balaṃ, etehi balavā bhikkhu, sukhaṃ jīvati paṇḍito.

example_1: amatamhi vijjamāne, kiṃ tava pañcakaṭukena pītena, sabbā hi kāmaratiyo, kaṭukatarā pañcakaṭukena.

sīladassanasampannaṃ, dhammaṭṭhaṃ saccavedinaṃ, attano kamma kubbānaṃ, taṃ jano kurute piyaṃ.
example_2: sace cuto sīlavatato hoti, pavedhatī kamma virādhayitvā, pajappatī patthayatī ca suddhiṃ, satthā'va hīno pavasaṃ gharamhā.
example_3: kiñ'cā'pi so kamma karoti pāpakaṃ, kāyena vācā uda cetasā vā, abhabba so tassa paṭicchadāya, abhabbatā diṭṭhapadassa vuttā, idam'pi saṅghe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ, etena saccena suvatthi hotu.

example_1: te puttamaṃsāni c'eva khādeyyuṃ, ure ca paṭipiseyyuṃ, kahaṃ, ekaputtaka, kahaṃ, ekaputtakā'ti
example_2: kahaṃ pana, bhikkhu, eta'r'ahi so bhagavā viharati arahaṃ sammāsambuddho'ti. atth'āvuso, uttaresu janapadesu sāvatthi nāma nagaraṃ. tattha so bhagavā eta'r'ahi viharati arahaṃ sammāsambuddho'ti.

meaning: how except for?; what besides?; what apart (from)?
example_1: yo hi, gahapati, imaṃ kāyaṃ pariharanto muhuttam'pi ārogyaṃ paṭijāneyya, kim'aññatra bālyā?
yāva'd'eva pana so mahājanakāyo kilamathassa vighātassa bhāgī assā'ti.
example_2: so kho ahaṃ, bhante, aññatr'eva asitapītakhāyitasāyitā aññatra uccārapassāvakammā aññatra niddākilamathapaṭivinodanā vassasat'āyuko vassasatajīvī vassasataṃ gantvā appatvā'va lokassa antaṃ antarā'y'eva kālaṅ'kato.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, yāni kānici kulāni bahu'tthikāni appapurisāni tāni suppadhaṃsiyāni honti corehi kumbhatthenakehi.
ahañ'hi, bhante, pahomi hatthidammaṃ sāretuṃ, yāvatakena antarena campaṃ gat'āgataṃ karissati sabbāni tāni sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni vaṅkeyyāni jimheyyāni pātukarissati.
example_2: yāni kho pan'assa honti sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni jimheyyāni vaṅkeyyāni, tāni yathābhūtaṃ āvikattā hoti satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu.

example_1: kodhano dubbaṇṇo hoti, atho dukkham'pi seti so, atho atthaṃ gahetvāna, anatthaṃ adhipajjati.
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo kodhano hoti upāyāsabahulo, appam'pi vutto samāno abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti.
example_3: vicikiccho vā tiṇṇavicikiccho nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi? kodhano vā akkodhano nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi? saṃkiliṭṭhacitto vā asaṃkiliṭṭhacitto nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi?
example_4: kodhano upanāhī ca, pāpamakkhī ca yo naro, vipannadiṭṭhi māyāvī, taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.

meaning: seems good (to); is acceptable (to); is suitable (for); is pleasing (to)
example_1: dhammavādī c'eso bhikkhu, vinayavādī c'eso bhikkhu, amhākañ'c'eso bhikkhu chandañ'ca ruciñ'ca ādāya voharati, jānāti, no bhāsati, amhākam'p'etaṃ khamatī'ti
example_2: imesaṃ kho, potaliya, catunnaṃ puggalānaṃ katamo te puggalo khamati abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro cā'ti?
example_3: atthaṃ upaparikkhato dhammā nijjhānaṃ khamanti, dhammanijjhānakkhantiyā sati chando jāyati, chandajāto ussahati, ussāhetvā tuleti, tulayitvā padahati,
example_4: tena hi, brāhmaṇa, taṃyevettha paṭipucchissāmi. yathā te khameyya tathā naṃ byākareyyāsi. taṃ kiṃ maññasi, brāhmaṇa, kusalo tvaṃ rājagahagāmissa maggassā'ti

example_1: yo c'āyaṃ attakilamath'ānuyogo dukkho anariyo anatthasañhito.

meaning: having given; having offered; having donated (something to someone)
example_1: āyudo balado dhīro, vaṇṇado paṭibhāṇado. sukhassa dātā medhāvī, sukhaṃ so adhigacchati. āyuṃ datvā balaṃ vaṇṇaṃ, sukhañ'ca paṭibhānakaṃ, dīgh'āyu yasavā hoti, yattha yatth'ūpapajjati.
example_2: sace yāgu hoti, bhājanaṃ dhovitvā yāgu upanāmetabbā. yāguṃ pītassa udakaṃ datvā bhājanaṃ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena dhovitvā paṭisāmetabbaṃ.

example_4: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhussa sāmaṃ cīvaraṃ datvā, kupito anattamano, acchindeyya vā acchindāpeyya vā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

example_1: saddhādhanaṃ sīladhanaṃ, hirī ottappiyaṃ dhanaṃ, sutadhanañ'ca cāgo ca, paññā ve sattamaṃ dhanaṃ.

example_3: na hi verena verāni, sammant'īdha kudācanaṃ. averena ca sammanti, esa dhammo sanantano.

example_1: micchattaniyatā dhammā. sammattaniyatā dhammā. aniyatā dhammā
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo labhanto vā tathāgataṃ dassanāya alabhanto vā tathāgataṃ dassanāya, labhanto vā tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ savanāya alabhanto vā tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ savanāya n'eva okkamati niyāmaṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.
example_3: yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṃ saddahati adhimuccati, ayaṃ vuccati saddh'ānusārī, okkanto sammattaniyāmaṃ, sappurisabhūmiṃ okkanto, vītivatto puthujjanabhūmiṃ.

meaning: path with an inevitable destination; fixed correct course; (comm) noble path
example_1: yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṃ saddahati adhimuccati, ayaṃ vuccati saddh'ānusārī, okkanto sammattaniyāmaṃ, sappurisabhūmiṃ okkanto, vītivatto puthujjanabhūmiṃ.
paḷāsissa paḷāso appahīno hoti, issukissa issā appahīnā hoti, maccharissa macchariyaṃ appahīnaṃ hoti, saṭhassa sāṭheyyaṃ appahīnaṃ hoti, māyāvissa māyā appahīnā hoti
example_2: yāni kho pan'assa honti sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni jimheyyāni vaṅkeyyāni, tāni yathābhūtaṃ āvikattā hoti satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu.

meaning: value of good behaviour; treasure of conduct
example_1: saddhādhanaṃ sīladhanaṃ, hirī ottappiyaṃ dhanaṃ, sutadhanañ'ca cāgo ca, paññā ve sattamaṃ dhanaṃ.
saddhāya vaḍḍhati, sīlena vaḍḍhati, sutena vaḍḍhati, cāgena vaḍḍhati, paññāya vaḍḍhati.
example_2: tassa attano ca tāsañ'ca devatānaṃ saddhañ'ca sīlañ'ca sutañ'ca cāgañ'ca paññañ'ca anussarato cittaṃ pasīdati, pāmojjaṃ uppajjati, ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti
example_3: saddhādhanaṃ sīladhanaṃ, hirī ottappiyaṃ dhanaṃ, sutadhanañ'ca cāgo ca, paññā ve sattamaṃ dhanaṃ.

meaning: value of learning; treasure of knowledge
example_1: saddhādhanaṃ sīladhanaṃ, hirī ottappiyaṃ dhanaṃ, sutadhanañ'ca cāgo ca, paññā ve sattamaṃ dhanaṃ.

meaning: easily overwhelmed (by); easily overcome (by); easily knocked over (by)
example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, yāni kānici kulāni bahu'tthikāni appapurisāni tāni suppadhaṃsiyāni honti corehi kumbhatthenakehi.
example_2: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yassa kassaci bhikkhuno mettācetovimutti abhāvitā abahulīkatā so suppadhaṃsiyo hoti amanussehi.

example_1: yaṅ'kiñci vittaṃ idha vā huraṃ vā, saggesu vā yaṃ ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ, na no samaṃ atthi tathāgatena, idam'pi buddhe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ, etena saccena suvatthi hotu.
example_2: yān'īdha bhūtāni samāgatāni, bhummāni vā yāni va antalikkhe, tathāgataṃ devamanussapūjitaṃ, buddhaṃ namassāma suvatthi hotu.

example_1: āsītikaṃ vā nāvutikaṃ vā vassasatikaṃ vā jātiyā jiṇṇaṃ gopānasivaṅkaṃ bhoggaṃ daṇḍaparāyaṇaṃ pavedhamānaṃ gacchantaṃ
ahañ'hi, bhante, pahomi hatthidammaṃ sāretuṃ, yāvatakena antarena campaṃ gat'āgataṃ karissati sabbāni tāni sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni vaṅkeyyāni jimheyyāni pātukarissati.
example_2: yāni kho pan'assa honti sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni jimheyyāni vaṅkeyyāni, tāni yathābhūtaṃ āvikattā hoti satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu.

example_1: āyudo balado dhīro, vaṇṇado paṭibhāṇado. sukhassa dātā medhāvī, sukhaṃ so adhigacchati. āyuṃ datvā balaṃ vaṇṇaṃ, sukhañ'ca paṭibhānakaṃ, dīgh'āyu yasavā hoti, yattha yatth'ūpapajjati
example_2: atha kho aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami
example_3: āyuṃ arogiyaṃ vaṇṇaṃ, saggaṃ uccākulīnataṃ, ratiyo patthayantena, uḷārā apar'āparā.
example_4: tesaṃ taṃ vaṇṇāya c'eva hoti balāya ca, na ca tatonidānaṃ maraṇaṃ vā nigacchanti maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhaṃ.

example_1: ambho purisa, na tvaṃ addasa manussesu itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā āsītikaṃ vā nāvutikaṃ vā vassasatikaṃ vā jātiyā, jiṇṇaṃ gopānasivaṅkaṃ bhoggaṃ daṇḍaparāyanaṃ pavedhamānaṃ gacchantiṃ
kodhano upanāhī ca, pāpamakkhī ca yo naro, vipannadiṭṭhi māyāvī, taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.

meaning: who has wrong view; with perverted belief
example_1: kodhano upanāhī ca, pāpamakkhī ca yo naro, vipannadiṭṭhi māyāvī, taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.
yass'antarato na santi kopā, itibhavābhavatañ'ca vītivatto, so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ, urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.
example_2: yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṃ saddahati adhimuccati, ayaṃ vuccati saddh'ānusārī, okkanto sammattaniyāmaṃ, sappurisabhūmiṃ okkanto, vītivatto puthujjanabhūmiṃ.

example_1: yo pana bhikkhu aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā antaragharaṃ paviṭṭhāya hatthato khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, paṭidesetabbaṃ tena bhikkhunā
example_2: yo pana bhikkhu aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā hatthato cīvaraṃ paṭiggaṇheyya aññatra pārivattakā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
